revised_title: Fossil Plant Organization in Coal Measures: A Detailed Study
tldr: The author examines the organization and structure of fossil plants found in the coal measures, focusing on the rare strobilus known as Volkmanniain. They describe the axial vascular bundle, axial cortex, and disk-rays, providing detailed illustrations and analysis of the plant's features. This study contributes to our understanding of the evolution and classification of ancient plants.
